card.name: Alabaster Potion
card.property: Choose one — • Target player gains X life. • Prevent the next X damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Healing is a matter of time, but it is sometimes also a matter of opportunity." —D'Avenant proverb

card.name: Amrou Kithkin
card.property: Amrou Kithkin can't be blocked by creatures with power 3 or greater.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Quick and agile, Amrou Kithkin can usually escape from even the most fearsome opponents.

card.name: Angry Mob
card.property: Trample As long as it's your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Swamps your opponents control. As long as it's not your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each 2.

card.name: Animate Wall
card.property: Enchant Wall Enchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.

card.name: Armageddon
card.property: Destroy all lands.

card.name: Balance
card.property: Each player chooses a number of lands they control equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.

card.name: Benalish Hero
card.property: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the Hero.

card.name: Black Ward
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature has protection from black. This effect doesn't remove Black Ward.

card.name: Blessing
card.property: Enchant creature {W}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature has protection from blue. This effect doesn't remove Blue Ward.

card.name: Brainwash
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature can't attack unless its controller pays {3}.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "They're not your friends; they despise you. I'm the only one you can count on. Trust me."

card.name: Castle
card.property: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.

card.name: Circle of Protection: Artifacts
card.property: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

card.property: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +3/+3.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Glory surged through her and radiance surrounded her. All things were possible with the blessing of the Divine.

card.name: Elder Land Wurm
card.property: Defender, trample When Elder Land Wurm blocks, it loses defender.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Sometimes it's best to let sleeping dragons lie.

card.name: Eye for an Eye

If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +0/+2. {W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

card.property: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.

card.name: Karma
card.property: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Karma deals damage to that player equal to the number of Swamps they control.

card.name: Kismet

card.name: Land Tax
card.property: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Mesa Pegasus
card.property: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

card.name: Morale
card.property: Attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "After Lacjsi's speech, the Knights grew determined to crush their ancient enemies clan by clan."—Tivadar of Thorn, *History of the Goblin Wars*

card.name: Northern Paladin
card.property: {W} {W}, {T}: Destroy target black permanent.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Look to the north; there you will find aid and comfort." —The Book of Tal

card.name: Osai Vultures
card.property: Flying At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, put a carrion counter on Osai Vultures. Remove two carrion counters from Osai Vultures: Osai Vultures gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' 'Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, 'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'" —Lewis Carroll

card.name: Personal Incarnation
card.property: {0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Only Personal Incarnation's owner may activate this ability. When Personal Incarnation dies, its owner loses half their life, rounded up.

card.name: Piety
card.property: Blocking creatures get +0/+3 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Whoever obeys God and His Prophet, fears God and does his duty to Him, will surely find success."—*The Qur'an, 24:52*

card.name: Pikemen
card.property: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "As the cavalry bore down, we faced them with swords drawn and pikes hidden in the grass at our feet. 'Don't lift your pikes 'til I give the word,' I said." —Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

card.name: Purelace
card.property: Target spell or permanent becomes white. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

card.name: Red Ward
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature has protection from red. This effect doesn't remove Red Ward.

card.property: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

card.name: Righteousness
card.property: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

card.name: Samite Healer
card.property: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless, flat plains of their homeland.

card.name: Seeker
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or white creatures.

card.name: Serra Angel
card.property: Flying, vigilance

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.

card.property: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

card.name: Tundra Wolves
card.property: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains.

card.name: Visions
card.property: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. You may then have that player shuffle that library.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Visions of glory, spare my aching sight, Ye unborn ages, crowd not on my soul!"—Thomas Gray, *"The Bard"*

card.name: Wall of Swords
card.property: Defender (This creature can't attack.) Flying

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Just as the evil ones approached to slay Justina, she cast a great spell, imbuing her weapons with her own life force. Thus she fulfilled the prophecy: "In the death of your savior will you find salvation."

card.name: White Knight
card.property: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.) Protection from black (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything black.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Out of the blackness and stench of the engulfing swamp emerged a shimmering figure. Only the splattered armor and ichor-stained sword hinted at the unfathomable evil the Knight had just laid waste.

card.name: White Ward
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature has protection from white. This effect doesn't remove White Ward.

card.name: Wrath of God
card.property: Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated.

card.name: Air Elemental
card.property: Flying

property.name: Flavor
property.value: These spirits of the air are winsome and wild and cannot be truly contained. Only marginally intelligent, they often substitute whimsy for strategy, delighting in mischief and mayhem.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: ". . . [A]nd gives to airy nothing A local habitation and a name." —William Shakespeare, A Midsummer-Night's Dream

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "That phantom prow split the storm as lightning cast its long shadow on the battlefield below." —Mireille Gaetane, The Valeriad

property.name: Flavor
property.value: This spell, like many attributed to Drafna, was actually the work of his wife and former student, Hurkyl.

card.name: Island Fish Jasconius

Island Fish Jasconius can't attack unless defending player controls an Island. When you control no Islands, sacrifice Island Fish Jasconius.

card.name: Jump
card.property: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

card.name: Leviathan
card.property: Trample Leviathan enters the battlefield tapped and doesn't untap during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may sacrifice two Islands. If you do, untap Leviathan. Leviathan can't attack unless you sacrifice two Islands. (This cost is paid as attackers are declared.)

card.name: Lifetap

property.name: Flavor
property.value: A master of tactics, the Lord of Atlantis makes his people bold in battle merely by arriving to lead them.

card.name: Magical Hack

card.name: Mahamoti Djinn
card.property: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Of royal blood among the spirits of the air, the Mahamoti Djinn rides on the wings of the winds. As dangerous in the gambling hall as he is in battle, he is a master of trickery and misdirection.

card.name: Mana Short
card.property: Tap all lands target player controls and that player loses all unspent mana.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Most human scholars believe that Merfolk are the survivors of sunken Atlantis, humans adapted to the water. Merfolk, however, believe that humans sprang forth from Merfolk who adapted themselves in order to explore their last frontier.

card.name: Mind Bomb
card.property: Each player may discard up to three cards. Mind Bomb deals damage to each player equal to 3 minus the number of cards they discarded this way.

card.name: Phantasmal Forces
card.property: Flying At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Phantasmal Forces unless you pay {U}.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: These beings embody the essence of true heroes long dead. Summoned from the dreamrealms, they rise to meet their enemies.

card.name: Phantasmal Terrain
card.property: Enchant land As Phantasmal Terrain enters the battlefield, choose a basic land type. Enchanted land is the chosen type.

card.name: Phantom Monster
card.property: Flying

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "While, like a ghastly rapid river, Through the pale door, A hideous throng rush out forever, And laugh—but smile no more." —Edgar Allan Poe, "The Haunted Palace"

card.name: Pirate Ship
card.property: Pirate Ship can't attack unless defending player controls an Island. {T}: Pirate Ship deals 1 damage to any target. When you control no Islands, sacrifice Pirate Ship.

card.name: Prodigal Sorcerer

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Occasionally a member of the Institute of Arcane Study acquires a taste for worldly pleasures. Seldom do they have trouble finding employment.

card.name: Psionic Entity
card.property: {T}: Psionic Entity deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to itself.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Creatures of the Æther are notorious for neglecting their own well-being.

card.name: Psychic Venom

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Legend has it that Serpents used to be bigger, but how could that be?

card.name: Segovian Leviathan
card.property: Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Leviathan, too! Can you catch him with a fish-hook or run a line round his tongue?" —Job 40:25

card.name: Sindbad
card.property: {T}: Draw a card and reveal it. If it isn't a land card, discard it.

At the beginning of the next end step, destroy all non-Wall creatures that player controls that didn't attack this turn. Ignore this effect for each creature the player didn't control continuously since the beginning of the turn.

card.name: Thoughtlace
card.property: Target spell or permanent becomes blue. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

card.name: Time Elemental
card.property: When Time Elemental attacks or blocks, at end of combat, sacrifice it and it deals 5 damage to you. {2}{U}{U}, {T}: Return target permanent that isn't enchanted to its owner's hand.

card.name: Twiddle
card.property: You may tap or untap target artifact, creature, or land.

card.name: Unstable Mutation

card.name: Unsummon
card.property: Return target creature to its owner's hand.

card.name: Volcanic Eruption
card.property: Destroy X target Mountains. Volcanic Eruption deals damage to each creature and each player equal to the number of Mountains put into a graveyard this way.

card.name: Wall of Air
card.property: Defender, flying (This creature can't attack, and it can block creatures with flying.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "This 'standing windstorm' can hold us off indefinitely? Ridiculous!" Saying nothing, she put a pinch of salt on the table. With a bang she clapped her hands, and the salt disappeared, blown away.

card.name: Wall of Water
card.property: Defender (This creature can't attack.) {U}: Wall of Water gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: A deafening roar arose as the fury of an enormous vertical river supplanted our serenity. Eddies turned into whirling geysers, leveling everything in their path.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Unpredictable as the sea itself, Water Elementals shift without warning from tranquility to tempest. Capricious and fickle, they flow restlessly from one shape to another, expressing their moods with their physical forms.

card.name: Zephyr Falcon
card.property: Flying, vigilance

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Although greatly prized among falconers, the Zephyr Falcon is capricious and not easily tamed.

card.name: Abomination
card.property: Whenever Abomination blocks or becomes blocked by a green or white creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

card.name: Animate Dead
card.property: Enchant creature card in a graveyard When Animate Dead enters the battlefield, if it's on the battlefield, it loses "enchant creature card in a graveyard" and gains "enchant creature put onto the battlefield with Animate Dead." Return enchanted creature card to the battlefield under your control and attach Animate Dead to it. When Animate Dead leaves the battlefield, that creature's controller sacrifices it. Enchanted creature gets -1/-0.

card.name: Ashes to Ashes
card.property: Exile two target nonartifact creatures. Ashes to Ashes deals 5 damage to you.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "All rivers eventually run to the sea. My job is to sort out who goes first." —Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

card.name: Bad Moon
card.property: Black creatures get +1/+1.

card.name: Black Knight
card.property: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.) Protection from white (This creature can't be blocked, targeted, dealt damage, or enchanted by anything white.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Battle doesn't need a purpose; the battle is its own purpose. You don't ask why a plague spreads or a field burns. Don't ask why I fight.

card.name: Blight
card.property: Enchant land When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.

card.name: Bog Imp
card.property: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: On guard for larger dangers, we underestimated the power and speed of the Imp's muck-crusted claws.

card.name: Bog Wraith
card.property: Swampwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: 'Twas in the bogs of Cannelbrae My mate did meet an early grave 'Twas nothing left for us to save In the peat-filled bogs of Cannelbrae.

card.name: Carrion Ants
card.property: {1}: Carrion Ants gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "War is no picnic," my father liked to say. But the Ants seemed to disagree.

card.name: Cosmic Horror

property.name: Flavor
property.value: ". . . [S]creams of horror rend th' affrighted skies." —Alexander Pope, The Rape of the Lock

card.name: Cursed Land

card.name: Cyclopean Mummy
card.property: When Cyclopean Mummy dies, exile it.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The ritual of plucking out an eye to gain future sight is but a curse that enables the living to see their own deaths.

card.name: Dark Ritual

card.property: Target spell or permanent becomes black. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Bones scattered around us joined to form misshapen bodies. We struck at them repeatedly—they fell, but soon formed again, with the same mocking look on their faceless skulls.

card.name: El-Hajjâj

card.name: Evil Presence

card.name: Fear

card.name: Frozen Shade
card.property: {B}: Frozen Shade gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "There are some qualities, some incorporate things, / That have a double life, which thus is made / A type of twin entity which springs / From matter and light, evinced in solid and shade." —Edgar Allan Poe, "Silence"

card.name: Gloom

card.name: Greed

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "There is no calamity greater than lavish desires. . . . And there is no greater disaster than greed." —Tao Tê Ching 46

property.name: Flavor

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Her hand gently beckons, she whispers your name— But those who go with her are never the same.

card.name: Marsh Gas

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Comes right outta th' ground. If ya can smell it, it's too late."—Keevy Bogsbury

card.name: Mind Twist
card.property: Target player discards X cards at random.

card.name: Murk Dwellers
card.property: Whenever Murk Dwellers attacks and isn't blocked, it gets +2/+0 until end of combat.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: When Raganorn unsealed the catacombs, he found more than the dead and their treasures.

card.name: Nether Shadow
card.property: Haste At the beginning of your upkeep, if Nether Shadow is in your graveyard with three or more creature cards above it, you may put Nether Shadow onto the battlefield.

card.name: Nightmare
card.property: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) Nightmare's power and toughness are each equal to the number of Swamps you control.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Nightmare arises from its lair in the swamps. As the poisoned land spreads, so does the Nightmare's rage and terrifying strength.

card.name: Paralyze
card.property: Enchant creature When Paralyze enters the battlefield, tap enchanted creature. Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step. At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, that player may pay {4}. If the player does, untap the creature.

card.name: Pestilence
card.property: At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Pestilence. {B}: Pestilence deals 1 damage to each creature and each player.

card.name: Pit Scorpion
card.property: Whenever Pit Scorpion deals damage to a player, that player gets a poison counter. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Sometimes the smallest nuisance can be the greatest pain.

card.name: Plague Rats
card.property: Plague Rats's power and toughness are each equal to the number of creatures named Plague Rats on the battlefield.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: During the dark times, the rats seemed to grow ever stronger.

card.name: Rag Man

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Aw, he's just a silly, dirty little man. What's to be afraid of?"

card.name: Raise Dead
card.property: Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.

card.name: Royal Assassin
card.property: {T}: Destroy target tapped creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Trained in the arts of stealth, the Royal Assassins choose their victims carefully, relying on timing and precision rather than brute force.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "They groaned, they stirred, they all uprose, Nor spake, nor moved their eyes; It had been strange, even in a dream, To have seen those dead men rise." —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

card.name: Scavenging Ghoul
card.property: At the beginning of each end step, put a corpse counter on Scavenging Ghoul for each creature that died this turn. Remove a corpse counter from Scavenging Ghoul: Regenerate Scavenging Ghoul.

card.name: Sengir Vampire
card.property: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) Whenever a creature dealt damage by Sengir Vampire this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on Sengir Vampire.

card.name: Simulacrum
card.property: You gain life equal to the damage dealt to you this turn. Simulacrum deals damage to target creature you control equal to the damage dealt to you this turn.

card.name: Sorceress Queen
card.property: {T}: Target creature other than Sorceress Queen has base power and toughness 0/2 until end of turn.

card.name: Spirit Shackle
card.property: Enchant creature Whenever enchanted creature becomes tapped, put a -0/-2 counter on it.

card.name: Terror
card.property: Destroy target nonartifact, nonblack creature. It can't be regenerated.

card.name: Uncle Istvan
card.property: Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Uncle Istvan by creatures.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Solitude drove the old hermit insane. Now he only keeps company with those he can catch.

card.name: Unholy Strength
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +2/+1.

card.name: Vampire Bats
card.property: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) {B}: Vampire Bats gets +1/+0 until end of turn. Activate this ability no more than twice each turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "For something is amiss or out of place When mice with wings can wear a human face." —Theodore Roethke, "The Bat"

card.name: Wall of Bone
card.property: Defender (This creature can't attack.) {B}: Regenerate Wall of Bone. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Wall of Bone is said to be an aspect of the Great Wall in Hel, where the bones of all sinners wait for Ragnarok, when Hela will call them forth for the final battle.

card.name: Warp Artifact
card.property: Enchant artifact At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted artifact's controller, Warp Artifact deals 1 damage to that player.

card.name: Weakness
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets -2/-1.

card.name: Will-o'-the-Wisp
card.property: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) {B}: Regenerate Will-o'-the-Wisp. (The next time this creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "About, about in reel and rout The death-fires danced at night; The water, like a witch's oils, Burnt green, and blue and white." —Samuel Coleridge, "The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"

card.name: Word of Binding
card.property: Tap X target creatures.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "That was the worst experience of my days: standing there helpless as they killed my whole troop."—Maeveen O'Donagh, *Memoirs of a Soldier*

card.name: Xenic Poltergeist
card.property: {T}: Until your next upkeep, target noncreature artifact becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost.

card.name: Zombie Master
card.property: Other Zombie creatures have swampwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Swamp.) Other Zombies have "{B}: Regenerate this permanent."

property.name: Flavor
property.value: They say the Zombie Master controlled these foul creatures even before his own death, but now that he is one of them, nothing can make them betray him.

card.name: Ali Baba
card.property: {R}: Tap target Wall.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "When he reached the entrance of the cavern, he pronounced the words, 'Open, Sesame!'"—*The Arabian Nights*, Junior Classics trans.

card.name: Ball Lightning
card.property: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.) Haste (This creature can attack and {T} as soon as it comes under your control.) At the beginning of the end step, sacrifice Ball Lightning.

card.name: Bird Maiden
card.property: Flying

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Four things that never meet do here unite To shed my blood and to ravage my heart, A radiant brow and tresses that beguile And rosy cheeks and a glittering smile." —The Arabian Nights, trans. Haddawy

card.name: Blood Lust
card.property: If target creature has toughness 5 or greater, it gets +4/-4 until end of turn. Otherwise, it gets +4/-X until end of turn, where X is its toughness minus 1.

card.name: Brothers of Fire

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Fire is never a gentle master.

card.name: Burrowing
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature has mountainwalk. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

card.name: Cave People
card.property: Whenever Cave People attacks, it gets +1/-2 until end of turn. {1}{R}{R}, {T}: Target creature gains mountainwalk until end of turn. (It can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

card.name: Chaoslace
card.property: Target spell or permanent becomes red. (Its mana symbols remain unchanged.)

card.name: Crimson Manticore
card.property: Flying {R}, {T}: Crimson Manticore deals 1 damage to target attacking or blocking creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Noted neither for their good looks nor their charm, Manticores can be fearsome allies. As dinner companions, however, they are best left alone.

card.name: Detonate
card.property: Destroy target artifact with converted mana cost X. It can't be regenerated. Detonate deals X damage to that artifact's controller.

card.name: Disintegrate
card.property: Disintegrate deals X damage to any target. If it's a creature, it can't be regenerated this turn, and if it would die this turn, exile it instead.

card.name: Dragon Whelp
card.property: Flying {R}: Dragon Whelp gets +1/+0 until end of turn. If this ability has been activated four or more times this turn, sacrifice Dragon Whelp at the beginning of the next end step.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "O to be a dragon . . . of silkworm size or immense . . ."—Marianne Moore, *"O to Be a Dragon"*

card.name: Dwarven Warriors
card.property: {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Earth Elementals have the eternal strength of stone and the endurance of mountains. Primordially connected to the land they inhabit, they take a long-term view of things, scorning the impetuous haste of short-lived mortal creatures.

card.name: Earthquake
card.property: Earthquake deals X damage to each creature without flying and each player.

card.name: Eternal Warrior
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature has vigilance.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Warriors of the Tsunami-nito School spend years in training to master the way of effortless effort.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Fire Elementals are ruthless infernos, annihilating and consuming their foes in a frenzied holocaust. Crackling and blazing, they sear swift, terrible paths, leaving the land charred and scorched in their wake.

card.name: Fireball
card.property: This spell costs {1} more to cast for each target beyond the first. Fireball deals X damage divided evenly, rounded down, among any number of targets.

card.name: Firebreathing
card.property: Enchant creature {R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "And topples round the dreary west A looming bastion fringed with fire." —Alfred, Lord Tennyson, "In Memoriam"

card.name: Fissure
card.property: Destroy target creature or land. It can't be regenerated.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Must not all things at the last be swallowed up in death?" —Plato

card.name: Flashfires
card.property: Destroy all Plains.

card.name: Giant Strength
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +2/+2.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "O! it is excellent To have a giant's strength, but it is tyrannous To use it like a giant." —William Shakespeare, Measure for Measure

card.name: Goblin Balloon Brigade
card.property: {R}: Goblin Balloon Brigade gains flying until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "From up here we can drop rocks and arrows and more rocks!" "Uh, yeah boss, but how do we get down?"

card.name: Goblin King
card.property: Other Goblin creatures get +1/+1 and have mountainwalk. (They can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Mountain.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: To become king of the Goblins, one must assassinate the previous king. Thus, only the most foolish seek positions of leadership.

card.name: Goblin Rock Sled
card.property: Trample Goblin Rock Sled doesn't untap during your untap step if it attacked during your last turn. Goblin Rock Sled can't attack unless defending player controls a Mountain.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Ogre philosopher Gnerdel believed the purpose of life was to live as high on the food chain as possible. She refused to eat vegetarians, preferring to live entirely on creatures that preyed on sentient beings.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Fortunately, Hill Giants have large blind spots in which a human can easily hide. Unfortunately, these blind spots are beneath the bottoms of their feet.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Minotaurs of the Hurloon Mountains are known for their love of battle. They are also known for their hymns to the dead, sung for friend and foe alike. These hymns can last for days, filling the mountain valleys with their low, haunting sounds.

card.name: Hurr Jackal
card.property: {T}: Target creature can't be regenerated this turn.

card.name: Immolation
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +2/-2.

card.name: Inferno
card.property: Inferno deals 6 damage to each creature and each player.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Any scrap of compassion that still existed in my soul was permanently snuffed out when they cast me out into the flames." —Mairsil, called the Pretender

card.name: Ironclaw Orcs
card.property: Ironclaw Orcs can't block creatures with power 2 or greater.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Generations of genetic weeding have given rise to the deviously cowardly Ironclaw clan. To say that Orcs in general are vicious, depraved, and ignoble does not do justice to the Ironclaw.

card.name: Keldon Warlord
card.property: Keldon Warlord's power and toughness are each equal to the number of non-Wall creatures you control.

card.name: Lightning Bolt
card.property: Lightning Bolt deals 3 damage to any target.

card.name: Magnetic Mountain
card.property: Blue creatures don't untap during their controllers' untap steps. At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player may choose any number of tapped blue creatures they control and pay {4} for each creature chosen this way. If the player does, untap those creatures.

card.name: Mana Clash
card.property: You and target opponent each flip a coin. Mana Clash deals 1 damage to each player whose coin comes up tails. Repeat this process until both players' coins come up heads on the same flip.

card.name: Mana Flare
card.property: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, that player adds one mana of any type that land produced.

card.name: Manabarbs
card.property: Whenever a player taps a land for mana, Manabarbs deals 1 damage to that player.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The intricate dynamics of Rundvelt Goblin affairs are often confused with anarchy. The chaos, however, is the chaos of a thundercloud, and direction will sporadically and violently appear. Pashalik Mons and his Raiders are the thunderhead that leads in the storm.

card.name: Orcish Artillery
card.property: {T}: Orcish Artillery deals 2 damage to any target and 3 damage to you.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: In a rare display of ingenuity, the Orcs invented an incredibly destructive weapon. Most Orcish artillerists are those who dared criticize its effectiveness.

card.name: Orcish Oriflamme
card.property: Attacking creatures you control get +1/+0.

card.name: Power Surge
card.property: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Power Surge deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of untapped lands they controlled at the beginning of this turn.

card.name: Pyrotechnics
card.property: Pyrotechnics deals 4 damage divided as you choose among any number of targets.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Hi! ni! ya! Behold the man of flint, that's me! Four lightnings zigzag from me, strike and return." —Navajo war chant

card.name: Red Elemental Blast
card.property: Choose one — • Counter target blue spell. • Destroy target blue permanent.

card.name: Shatter
card.property: Destroy target artifact.

card.name: Shivan Dragon
card.property: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.) {R}: Shivan Dragon gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: While it's true most Dragons are cruel, the Shivan Dragon seems to take particular glee in the misery of others, often tormenting its victims much like a cat plays with a mouse before delivering the final blow.

card.name: Sisters of the Flame
card.property: {T}: Add {R}.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: We are many wicks sharing a common tallow; we feed the skies with the ashes of our prey.

card.name: Smoke
card.property: Players can't untap more than one creature during their untap steps.

card.name: Stone Giant
card.property: {T}: Target creature you control with toughness less than Stone Giant's power gains flying until end of turn. Destroy that creature at the beginning of the next end step.

card.name: Stone Rain
card.property: Destroy target land.

card.name: Tempest Efreet
card.property: Remove Tempest Efreet from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante. {T}, Sacrifice Tempest Efreet: Target opponent may pay 10 life. If that player doesn't, they reveal a card at random from their hand. Exchange ownership of the revealed card and Tempest Efreet. Put the revealed card into your hand and Tempest Efreet from anywhere into that player's graveyard. This change in ownership is permanent.

card.name: The Brute
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +1/+0. {R}{R}{R}: Regenerate enchanted creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Union may be strength, but it is mere blind brute strength unless wisely directed."—Samuel Butler

card.name: Tunnel
card.property: Destroy target Wall. It can't be regenerated.

card.name: Uthden Troll
card.property: {R}: Regenerate Uthden Troll.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Oi oi oi, me gotta hurt in 'ere, Oi oi oi, me smell a ting is near, Gonna bosh 'n gonna nosh 'n da hurt'll disappear." —Troll chant

card.name: Wall of Dust
card.property: Defender (This creature can't attack.) Whenever Wall of Dust blocks a creature, that creature can't attack during its controller's next turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: An ever-moving swarm of dust engulfs and disorients anything that comes near.

card.name: Wall of Fire
card.property: Defender (This creature can't attack.) {R}: Wall of Fire gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Conjured from the bowels of hell, the fiery wall forms an impassable barrier, searing the soul of any creature attempting to pass through its terrible bursts of flame.

card.name: Wall of Stone
card.property: Defender (This creature can't attack.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The Earth herself lends her strength to these walls of living stone, which possess the stability of ancient mountains. These mighty bulwarks thwart ground-based troops, providing welcome relief for weary warriors who defend the land.

card.name: Winds of Change
card.property: Each player shuffles the cards from their hand into their library, then draws that many cards.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "'Tis the set of sails, and not the gales, Which tells us the way to go." —Ella Wheeler Wilcox

card.name: Aspect of Wolf
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature gets +X/+Y, where X is half the number of Forests you control, rounded down, and Y is half the number of Forests you control, rounded up.

card.name: Birds of Paradise
card.property: Flying {T}: Add one mana of any color.

card.name: Carnivorous Plant
card.property: Defender

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "It had a mouth like that of a great beast, and gnashed its teeth as it strained to reach us. I am thankful it possessed no means of locomotion." —Vervamon the Elder

card.name: Channel
card.property: Until end of turn, any time you could activate a mana ability, you may pay 1 life. If you do, add {C}.

card.name: Cockatrice
card.property: Flying Whenever Cockatrice blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The most terrifying thing about the Craw Wurm is probably the horrible crashing sound it makes as it speeds through the forest. This noise is so loud it echoes through the trees and seems to come from all directions at once.

card.name: Crumble
card.property: Destroy target artifact. It can't be regenerated. That artifact's controller gains life equal to its converted mana cost.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The spirits of Argoth grant new life to those who repent the folly of enslaving their labors to devices.

card.name: Desert Twister
card.property: Destroy target permanent.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "And the unclean spirits went out, and entered the swine: and the herd ran violently . . . ." —Mark 5:13

card.name: Elven Riders
card.property: Elven Riders can't be blocked except by Walls and/or creatures with flying.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Sometimes it is better to be swift of foot than strong of swordarm." —Elven proverb

card.name: Elvish Archers
card.property: First strike

property.name: Flavor
property.value: I tell you, there was so many arrows flying about you couldn't hardly see the sun. So I says to young Angus, "Well, at least now we're fighting in the shade!"

card.name: Fog
card.property: Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt this turn.

card.name: Force of Nature
card.property: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.) At the beginning of your upkeep, Force of Nature deals 8 damage to you unless you pay {G}{G}{G}{G}.

card.name: Fungusaur
card.property: Whenever Fungusaur is dealt damage, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Rather than sheltering her young, the female Fungusaur often injures her own offspring, thereby ensuring their rapid growth.

card.name: Gaea's Liege
card.property: As long as Gaea's Liege isn't attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests you control. As long as Gaea's Liege is attacking, its power and toughness are each equal to the number of Forests defending player controls. {T}: Target land becomes a Forest until Gaea's Liege leaves the battlefield.

card.name: Giant Growth
card.property: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.

card.name: Giant Spider
card.property: Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: While it possesses potent venom, the Giant Spider often chooses not to paralyze its victims. Perhaps the creature enjoys the gentle rocking motion caused by its captives' struggles to escape its web.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Don't try to outrun one of Dominia's Grizzlies; it'll catch you, knock you down, and eat you. Of course, you could run up a tree. In that case you'll get a nice view before it knocks the tree down and eats you.

card.name: Hurricane
card.property: Hurricane deals X damage to each creature with flying and each player.

card.name: Instill Energy
card.property: Enchant creature Enchanted creature can attack as though it had haste. {0}: Untap enchanted creature. Activate this ability only during your turn and only once each turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The mating habits of Treefolk, particularly the stalwart Ironroot Treefolk, are truly absurd. Molasses comes to mind. It's amazing the species can survive at all given such protracted periods of mate selection, conjugation, and gestation.

card.name: Killer Bees
card.property: Flying {G}: Killer Bees gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The communal mind produces a savage strategy, yet no one could predict that this vicious crossbreed would unravel the secret of steel.

card.name: Land Leeches
card.property: First strike

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The standard cure for leeches requires the application of burning embers. Alternative methods must be devised should an ember of sufficient size prove more harmful than the leech." —Vervamon the Elder

card.name: Ley Druid
card.property: {T}: Untap target land.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: After years of training, the Druid becomes one with nature, drawing power from the land and returning it when needed.

card.name: Lifeforce
card.property: {G} {G}: Counter target black spell.

card.name: Lifelace
card.property: Target spell or permanent becomes green. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

card.name: Living Artifact
card.property: Enchant artifact Whenever you're dealt damage, put that many vitality counters on Living Artifact. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove a vitality counter from Living Artifact. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Living Lands
card.property: All Forests are 1/1 creatures that are still lands.

card.name: Llanowar Elves
card.property: {T}: Add {G}.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Hardened by their life in the haunted Llanowar Forest, these fierce beings are outcasts among elvenkind.

card.name: Lure
card.property: Enchant creature All creatures able to block enchanted creature do so.

card.name: Marsh Viper
card.property: Whenever Marsh Viper deals damage to a player, that player gets two poison counters. (A player with ten or more poison counters loses the game.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "All we had left were their black and bloated bodies." —Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

card.name: Nafs Asp
card.property: Whenever Nafs Asp deals damage to a player, that player loses 1 life at the beginning of their next draw step unless they pay {1} before that draw step.

card.name: Pradesh Gypsies
card.property: {1} {G}, {T}: Target creature gets -2/-0 until end of turn.

card.name: Radjan Spirit
card.property: {T}: Target creature loses flying until end of turn.

card.name: Rebirth
card.property: Remove Rebirth from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante. Each player may ante the top card of their library. If a player does, that player's life total becomes 20.

card.name: Regeneration
card.property: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) {G}: Regenerate enchanted creature. (The next time that creature would be destroyed this turn, it isn't. Instead tap it, remove all damage from it, and remove it from combat.)

card.name: Sandstorm
card.property: Sandstorm deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Even the landscape turned against Sarsour, first rising up and pelting him, then rearranging itself so he could no longer find his way.

card.name: Scryb Sprites
card.property: Flying

property.name: Flavor
property.value: The only sound was the gentle clicking of the Faeries' wings. Then those intruders who were still standing turned and fled. One thing was certain: they didn't think the Scryb were very funny anymore.

card.name: Shanodin Dryads
card.property: Forestwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls a Forest.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Moving without sound, swift figures pass through branches and undergrowth completely unhindered. One with the trees around them, the Dryads of Shanodin Forest are seen only when they wish to be.

card.name: Stream of Life
card.property: Target player gains X life.

card.name: Sylvan Library
card.property: At the beginning of your draw step, you may draw two additional cards. If you do, choose two cards in your hand drawn this turn. For each of those cards, pay 4 life or put the card on top of your library.

card.name: Thicket Basilisk
card.property: Whenever Thicket Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Moss-covered statues littered the area, a macabre monument to the Basilisk's power.

card.name: Timber Wolves
card.property: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Though many think of Wolves as solitary predators, they are actually extremely social animals. During a hunt they often call to each other, which can be quite unsettling for their prey.

card.name: Titania's Song
card.property: Each noncreature artifact loses all abilities and becomes an artifact creature with power and toughness each equal to its converted mana cost. If Titania's Song leaves the battlefield, this effect continues until end of turn.

card.name: Tranquility
card.property: Destroy all enchantments.

card.name: Tsunami
card.property: Destroy all Islands.

card.name: Untamed Wilds
card.property: Search your library for a basic land card and put that card onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.

card.name: Venom
card.property: Enchant creature Whenever enchanted creature blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy the other creature at end of combat.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "I told him it was just a flesh wound, but the next time I looked at him, poor Tadhg was dead and gone." —Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

card.name: Verduran Enchantress
card.property: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Some say magic was first practiced by women, who have always felt strong ties to the land.

card.name: Wall of Brambles
card.property: Defender (This creature can't attack.) {G}: Regenerate Wall of Brambles.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "What else, when chaos draws all forces inward to shape a single leaf."—Conrad Aiken

card.name: Wall of Ice
card.property: Defender (This creature can't attack.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "And through the drifts the snowy cliffs Did send a dismal sheen: Nor shapes of men nor beasts we ken— The ice was all between."—Samuel Coleridge, *"The Rime of the Ancient Mariner"*

card.name: Wall of Wood
card.property: Defender (This creature can't attack.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Everybody knows that to ward off trouble, you knock on wood. But usually it's better to make a wall out of the wood and let trouble do the knocking.

card.name: Wanderlust
card.property: Enchant creature At the beginning of the upkeep of enchanted creature's controller, Wanderlust deals 1 damage to that player.

card.name: War Mammoth
card.property: Trample

property.name: Flavor
property.value: I didn't think Mammoths could ever hold a candle to a well-trained battle horse. Then one day I turned my back on a drunken soldier. His blow never landed; Mi'cha flung the brute over ten meters.

card.name: Web
card.property: Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.) Enchanted creature gets +0/+2 and has reach. (It can block creatures with flying.)

card.name: Whirling Dervish
card.property: Protection from black At the beginning of each end step, if Whirling Dervish dealt damage to an opponent this turn, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

card.name: Wild Growth
card.property: Enchant land Whenever enchanted land is tapped for mana, its controller adds an additional {G}.

card.name: Winter Blast
card.property: Tap X target creatures. Winter Blast deals 2 damage to each of those creatures with flying.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "Blow, winds, and crack your cheeks! rage! blow!" —William Shakespeare, King Lear

card.name: Aladdin's Lamp
card.property: {X}, {T}: The next time you would draw a card this turn, instead look at the top X cards of your library, put all but one of them on the bottom of your library in a random order, then draw a card. X can't be 0.

card.name: Aladdin's Ring
card.property: {8}, {T}: Aladdin's Ring deals 4 damage to any target.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "After these words the magician drew a ring off his finger, and put it on one of Aladdin's, saying: 'It is a talisman against all evil, so long as you obey me.'" —The Arabian Nights, Junior Classics trans.

card.name: Amulet of Kroog
card.property: {2}, {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Among the first allies Urza gained were the people of Kroog. As a sign of friendship, Urza gave the healers of the city potent amulets; afterwards, thousands journeyed to Kroog in hope of healing.

card.name: Ankh of Mishra
card.property: Whenever a land enters the battlefield, Ankh of Mishra deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

card.name: Armageddon Clock
card.property: At the beginning of your upkeep, put a doom counter on Armageddon Clock. At the beginning of your draw step, Armageddon Clock deals damage equal to the number of doom counters on it to each player. {4}: Remove a doom counter from Armageddon Clock. Any player may activate this ability but only during any upkeep step.

card.name: Ashnod's Battle Gear
card.property: You may choose not to untap Ashnod's Battle Gear during your untap step. {2}, {T}: Target creature you control gets +2/-2 for as long as Ashnod's Battle Gear remains tapped.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: This invention shows why Ashnod was feared by her troops as well as her foes.

card.name: Battering Ram
card.property: At the beginning of combat on your turn, Battering Ram gains banding until end of combat. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's blocking.) Whenever Battering Ram becomes blocked by a Wall, destroy that Wall at end of combat.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: By the time Mishra was defeated, no mage was foolish enough to rely heavily on walls.

card.name: Black Mana Battery
card.property: {2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Black Mana Battery. {T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Black Mana Battery: Add {B}, then add an additional {B} for each charge counter removed this way.

card.name: Black Vise
card.property: As Black Vise enters the battlefield, choose an opponent. At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, Black Vise deals X damage to that player, where X is the number of cards in their hand minus 4.

card.name: Blue Mana Battery
card.property: {2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Blue Mana Battery. {T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Blue Mana Battery: Add {U}, then add an additional {U} for each charge counter removed this way.

card.name: Bottle of Suleiman
card.property: {1}, Sacrifice Bottle of Suleiman: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, create a 5/5 colorless Djinn artifact creature token with flying. If you lose the flip, Bottle of Suleiman deals 5 damage to you.

card.name: Brass Man
card.property: Brass Man doesn't untap during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {1}. If you do, untap Brass Man.

card.name: Bronze Tablet
card.property: Remove Bronze Tablet from your deck before playing if you're not playing for ante. Bronze Tablet enters the battlefield tapped. {4}, {T}: Exile Bronze Tablet and target nontoken permanent an opponent owns. That player may pay 10 life. If they do, put Bronze Tablet into its owner's graveyard. Otherwise, that player owns Bronze Tablet and you own the other exiled card.

card.name: Celestial Prism
card.property: {2}, {T}: Add one mana of any color.

card.name: Clay Statue
card.property: {2}: Regenerate Clay Statue.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Tawnos won fame as Urza's greatest assistant. After he created these warriors, Urza ended his apprenticeship, promoting him directly to the rank of master.

card.name: Clockwork Avian
card.property: Flying Clockwork Avian enters the battlefield with four +1/+0 counters on it. At end of combat, if Clockwork Avian attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it. {X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Avian to be greater than four. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

card.name: Clockwork Beast
card.property: Clockwork Beast enters the battlefield with seven +1/+0 counters on it. At end of combat, if Clockwork Beast attacked or blocked this combat, remove a +1/+0 counter from it. {X}, {T}: Put up to X +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast. This ability can't cause the total number of +1/+0 counters on Clockwork Beast to be greater than seven. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

card.name: Colossus of Sardia
card.property: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.) Colossus of Sardia doesn't untap during your untap step. {9}: Untap Colossus of Sardia. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: From the Sardian mountains wakes ancient doom: Warrior born from a rocky womb.

card.name: Conservator
card.property: {3}, {T}: Prevent the next 2 damage that would be dealt to you this turn.

card.name: Coral Helm
card.property: {3}, Discard a card at random: Target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

card.name: Crystal Rod
card.property: Whenever a player casts a blue spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Cursed Rack
card.property: As Cursed Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent. The chosen player's maximum hand size is four.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Ashnod invented several torture techniques that could make victims even miles away beg for mercy as if the End had come.

card.name: Dancing Scimitar
card.property: Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Bobbing merrily from opponent to opponent, the scimitar began adding playful little flourishes to its strokes; it even turned a couple of somersaults.

card.name: Diabolic Machine
card.property: {3}: Regenerate Diabolic Machine.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The bolts of our ballistae smashed into the monstrous thing, but our hopes died in our chests as its gears continued turning." —Sevti Mukul, The Fall of Alsoor

card.name: Dingus Egg
card.property: Whenever a land is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, Dingus Egg deals 2 damage to that land's controller.

card.name: Disrupting Scepter
card.property: {3}, {T}: Target player discards a card. Activate this ability only during your turn.

card.name: Dragon Engine
card.property: {2}: Dragon Engine gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Those who believed the city of Kroog would never fall to Mishra's forces severely underestimated the might of his war machines.

card.name: Ebony Horse
card.property: {2}, {T}: Untap target attacking creature you control. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by that creature this turn.

card.name: Fellwar Stone
card.property: {T}: Add one mana of any color that a land an opponent controls could produce.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "What do you have that I cannot obtain?" —Mairsil, called the Pretender

card.name: Flying Carpet
card.property: {2}, {T}: Target creature gains flying until end of turn.

card.name: Glasses of Urza
card.property: {T}: Look at target player's hand.

card.name: Grapeshot Catapult
card.property: {T}: Grapeshot Catapult deals 1 damage to target creature with flying.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Recent research suggests these creatures were invented by Urza's and Mishra's original master, Tocasia, and that both brothers used them.

card.name: Green Mana Battery
card.property: {2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Green Mana Battery. {T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Green Mana Battery: Add {G}, then add an additional {G} for each charge counter removed this way.

card.name: Helm of Chatzuk
card.property: {1}, {T}: Target creature gains banding until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding a player controls are blocking or being blocked by a creature, that player divides that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

card.name: Howling Mine
card.property: At the beginning of each player's draw step, if Howling Mine is untapped, that player draws an additional card.

card.name: Iron Star
card.property: Whenever a player casts a red spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Ivory Cup
card.property: Whenever a player casts a white spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Ivory Tower
card.property: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain X life, where X is the number of cards in your hand minus 4.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Valuing scholarship above all else, the inhabitants of the Ivory Tower reward those who sacrifice power for knowledge.

card.name: Jade Monolith
card.property: {1}: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to target creature this turn, that source deals that damage to you instead.

card.name: Jandor's Saddlebags
card.property: {3}, {T}: Untap target creature.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Each day of their journey, Jandor opened the saddlebags and found them full of mutton, quinces, cheese, date rolls, wine, and all manner of delicious and satisfying foods.

card.name: Jayemdae Tome
card.property: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.

card.name: Kormus Bell
card.property: All Swamps are 1/1 black creatures that are still lands.

card.name: Library of Leng
card.property: You have no maximum hand size. If an effect causes you to discard a card, discard it, but you may put it on top of your library instead of into your graveyard.

card.name: Mana Vault
card.property: Mana Vault doesn't untap during your untap step. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4}. If you do, untap Mana Vault. At the beginning of your draw step, if Mana Vault is tapped, it deals 1 damage to you. {T}: Add {C}{C}{C}.

card.name: Meekstone
card.property: Creatures with power 3 or greater don't untap during their controllers' untap steps.

card.name: Millstone
card.property: {2}, {T}: Target player puts the top two cards of their library into their graveyard.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: More than one mage was driven insane by the sound of the Millstone relentlessly grinding away.

card.name: Mishra's War Machine
card.property: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.) At the beginning of your upkeep, Mishra's War Machine deals 3 damage to you unless you discard a card. If Mishra's War Machine deals damage to you this way, tap it.

card.name: Nevinyrral's Disk
card.property: Nevinyrral's Disk enters the battlefield tapped. {1}, {T}: Destroy all artifacts, creatures, and enchantments.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: "The foot stone is connected to the ankle stone, the ankle stone is connected to the leg stone . . . ." —Song of the Artificer

card.name: Onulet
card.property: When Onulet dies, you gain 2 life.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: An early inspiration for Urza, Tocasia's Onulets contained magical essences that could be cannibalized after they stopped functioning.

card.name: Ornithopter
card.property: Flying

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Many scholars believe that these creatures were the result of Urza's first attempt at mechanical life, perhaps created in his early days as an apprentice to Tocasia.

card.name: Primal Clay
card.property: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

card.name: Red Mana Battery
card.property: {2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on Red Mana Battery. {T}, Remove any number of charge counters from Red Mana Battery: Add {R}, then add an additional {R} for each charge counter removed this way.

card.name: Rod of Ruin
card.property: {3}, {T}: Rod of Ruin deals 1 damage to any target.

card.name: Shapeshifter
card.property: As Shapeshifter enters the battlefield, choose a number between 0 and 7. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may choose a number between 0 and 7. Shapeshifter's power is equal to the last chosen number and its toughness is equal to 7 minus that number.

card.name: Soul Net
card.property: Whenever a creature dies, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Sunglasses of Urza
card.property: You may spend white mana as though it were red mana.

card.name: Tawnos's Wand
card.property: {2}, {T}: Target creature with power 2 or less can't be blocked this turn.

card.name: Tawnos's Weaponry
card.property: You may choose not to untap Tawnos's Weaponry during your untap step. {2}, {T}: Target creature gets +1/+1 for as long as Tawnos's Weaponry remains tapped.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: When war machines became too costly, Tawnos's Weaponry replaced them.

card.name: Tetravus
card.property: Flying Tetravus enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. At the beginning of your upkeep, you may remove any number of +1/+1 counters from Tetravus. If you do, create that many 1/1 colorless Tetravite artifact creature tokens. They each have flying and "This creature can't be enchanted." At the beginning of your upkeep, you may exile any number of tokens created with Tetravus. If you do, put that many +1/+1 counters on Tetravus.

card.name: The Hive
card.property: {5}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying named Wasp. (It can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)

card.name: The Rack
card.property: As The Rack enters the battlefield, choose an opponent. At the beginning of the chosen player's upkeep, The Rack deals X damage to that player, where X is 3 minus the number of cards in their hand.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Invented in Mishra's earlier days, the Rack was once his most feared creation.

card.name: Throne of Bone
card.property: Whenever a player casts a black spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Triskelion
card.property: Triskelion enters the battlefield with three +1/+1 counters on it. Remove a +1/+1 counter from Triskelion: It deals 1 damage to any target.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: A brainchild of Tawnos, the Triskelion later proved both versatile and useful.

card.name: Urza's Avenger
card.property: {0}: Urza's Avenger gets -1/-1 and gains your choice of banding, flying, first strike, or trample until end of turn. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Unable to settle on just one design, Urza decided to create one versatile being.

card.name: Wall of Spears
card.property: Defender (This creature can't attack.) First strike

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Even the most conservative generals revised their tactics after the Battle of Sarinth, during which a handful of peasant-pikemen held off a trio of rampaging Craw Wurms.

card.name: White Mana Battery
card.property: {2}, {T}: Put a charge counter on White Mana Battery. {T}, Remove any number of charge counters from White Mana Battery: Add {W}, then add an additional {W} for each charge counter removed this way.

card.name: Winter Orb
card.property: As long as Winter Orb is untapped, players can't untap more than one land during their untap steps.

card.name: Wooden Sphere
card.property: Whenever a player casts a green spell, you may pay {1}. If you do, you gain 1 life.

card.name: Yotian Soldier
card.property: Vigilance

property.name: Flavor
property.value: After Kroog was destroyed while most of its defenders were at his side, Urza vowed that none of his allies would ever need to fear for their own defense again, even while laying siege to a city far from their homes.

card.name: Mishra's Factory
card.property: {T}: Add {C}. {1}: Mishra's Factory becomes a 2/2 Assembly-Worker artifact creature until end of turn. It's still a land. {T}: Target Assembly-Worker creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Oasis
card.property: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.

card.name: Strip Mine
card.property: {T}: Add {C}. {T}, Sacrifice Strip Mine: Destroy target land.

property.name: Flavor
property.value: Unlike previous conflicts, the war between Urza and Mishra made Dominia itself a casualty of war.
